title: Australia to recognise Palestinian state in September
byline: Australia will recognise a Palestinian state at the UN General Assembly in September, following similar moves by the UK, France and Canada, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has said.

title: Railways deny losses despite images of empty compartments circulating online
byline: Despite photos of empty railway compartments circulating on social media, the Sri Lanka Railways Department has denied incurring any losses from reserved seats.

title: Three injured after lorry crashes and catches fire on Southern Expressway
byline: Three persons were injured when a lorry travelling from Kottawa collided with a security fence and caught fire on the Southern Expressway near the Kurundugahahethekma area.

title: ITAK alleges Army brutality, calls for hartal in North and East
byline: The Illankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi has written to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, urging an urgent and impartial investigation into the death of 32-year-old Edirmanasingam Kabilraj, whose body was found in the Muttaiyankattu Tank Saturday morning.

title: Chichi’s rocket: Cabinet fails to maintain collective responsibility: Thalatha
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has failed to maintain its collective responsibility through its contrasting utterances on the investment on the SupremeSAT project, United National Party (UNP) General Secretary Thalatha Athukorala said today.

title: Three soldiers from Mutthiyankattu Army Camp remanded over alleged murder
byline: A sergeant and two corporals attached to the 12 Sinha Regiment camp at Mutthiyankattu in the Mullaitivu Army Camp, who had been taken in connection with the death of a young man who called over at the Mutthiyankattu Army Camp to collect scrap iron, were produced before Mullaitivu Magistrate Dharmalingam Pradeepan and remanded till August 19.

title: Five Al Jazeera journalists killed in Israeli strike in Gaza
byline: Five Al Jazeera journalists including prominent reporter Anas al-Sharif have been killed in an Israeli strike near Gaza City’s Al-Shifa Hospital, the broadcaster has said.

title: Handing over of no-confidence motion against Aruna Jayasekera delayed
byline: The formal submission of a no-confidence motion against Deputy Defence Minister Aruna Jayasekera has been delayed due to the absence of Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne, parliamentary sources said today.

title: GMOA calls off planned strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has temporarily suspended its islandwide trade union action, which was set to begin today, citing “positive outcomes” from discussions held with the Health Minister.

title: Three arrested over Borella Sahaspura shooting
byline: Three suspects were arrested over the shooting incident near the Sahaspura housing complex in Borella, where two persons among the five injured succumbed to their injuries after being admitted to the hospital, police said.

title: Turkey earthquake flattens buildings in north-east Balikesir province
byline: One person has died in Turkey after a magnitude 6.1 earthquake struck the north-west province of Balikesir on Sunday evening.

title: Adithya Weliwatte crowned ‘Queen of International Tourism 2025’
byline: Sri Lankan beauty queen and renowned singer Adithya Weliwatte returned to the country this morning after winning the crown at the “Miss Tourism Universe 2025” pageant held in the Philippines.

title: Sri Lanka’s air power stalls as aircraft deals remain in limbo
byline: While many countries continue to enhance their maritime and aerial capabilities, Sri Lanka is gradually losing ground in these critical areas.

title: Daily Mirror awarded the ‘Most Popular English Newspaper 2025’
byline: The Daily Mirror was awarded the ‘Most Popular English newspaper 2025’ at the Global Business Excellence Awards held at the BMICH this evening.

title: Meteorite that hit home is older than Earth, scientists say
byline: A meteorite that crashed into a home in the US is older than planet Earth, scientists have said.

title: GMOA strikes again, holds patients hostage over demands
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has once again threatened to paralyze the country’s healthcare system, announcing an island-wide strike from tomorrow (11) if its demands are not met — a move that will leave thousands of patients caught in the crossfire.

title: Youth clubs used for political agendas during their time: Minister responds to Ranil
byline: Responding to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s claims on youth clubs, Youth Affairs Deputy Minister Eranga Gunasekara said today that the National Youth Council and the youth clubs were used for political agendas during their time and that the government is only trying to free the National Youth Council and the youth clubs from political mechanisms and provide opportunities for the talented youth to come forward.

title: Sri Lankan tycoon joins South Asia’s rich list
byline: As of 2025, Mukesh Ambani, chairman and managing director of Reliance Industries, remains the wealthiest individual in India and South Asia with an estimated net worth of $118 billion — and among those making the region’s billionaire ranks is Sri Lankan business magnate Ishara Nanayakkara, now valued at $1.6 billion.

title: National youth conference to be held after 32 years
byline: Arrangements have been made to hold a National Youth Conference in Sri Lanka after 32 years, Youth Affairs Deputy Minister Eranga Gunasekara said.

title: Grade 5 scholarship exam results expected by September 20
byline: The results of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, held today (10), are expected to be released before September 20, Examinations Department Commissioner General A.K.S. Indika Kumari Liyanage said.

title: Dates announced for 2025 GCE A/L and O/L exams
byline: The Examinations Department has announced that the 2025 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will be conducted from November 10 to December 5, 2025.

title: Ministry denies sending representative to Commonwealth Youth Conference
byline: The Youth Affairs and Sports Ministry clarified that it did not send any representative to the 1st Consultative Dialogue for Commonwealth Youth Ecosystem Stakeholders, despite reports circulating on social media.

title: Don’t let political parties gain control of youth clubs: Ranil
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today urged the Minister in charge of youth affairs and sports not to allow political parties to gain control of youth clubs.

title: President to visit US, Japan next month
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to visit the United States and Japan in September, 2025.
